title: How to Bake Bread Baskets

steps.headline: Take the rolling pin and roll the bread out flat.
steps.description: You don't have to worry about the crusts being flattened at the same time because you will be cutting the bread into rounds. This saves you having to cut them off at the start.

steps.headline: Keep rolling until the bread is about 1/8th of an inch (3 mm) thick.
steps.description: Some bread will take more effort than other bread. Keep rolling until it is very flat.

steps.headline: Take a cookie cutter, a knife or the rim of a small, round plastic container.
steps.description: Use this to cut rounds out of the bread.

steps.headline: Make as many rounds as you need.
steps.description: If you are having a party, making a dozen using the muffin tin is probably suitable.

steps.headline: Brush both sides of each round generously with olive oil.
steps.description: Keep a cloth or paper towel handy to wipe your fingers as the oil will make your hands greasy.

steps.headline: Press the bread rounds into the muffin tin hole.
Place the tin in the oven.
steps.description: Bake at 350ºF (180ºC) for approximately ten minutes. They will bake crispy and retain the basket shape for filling.

steps.headline: Remove from oven and allow to cool on a wire rack.
Add the filling.
steps.description:
Some examples include:
Cream cheese and salmon
Dill and mayo topped with a slice of smoked salmon
Bruschetta
Dips
Chopped cooked mixed veggies

text:
Switch on the oven. Set it to 350ºF / 180ºC. Take the rolling pin and roll the bread out flat. You don't have to worry about the crusts being flattened at the same time because you will be cutting the bread into rounds. This saves you having to cut them off at the start. Keep rolling until the bread is about 1/8th of an inch (3 mm) thick. Some bread will take more effort than other bread. Keep rolling until it is very flat. Take a cookie cutter, a knife or the rim of a small, round plastic container. Use this to cut rounds out of the bread. Make as many rounds as you need. If you are having a party, making a dozen using the muffin tin is probably suitable. Brush both sides of each round generously with olive oil. Keep a cloth or paper towel handy to wipe your fingers as the oil will make your hands greasy. Press the bread rounds into the muffin tin hole.  Place the tin in the oven. Bake at 350ºF (180ºC) for approximately ten minutes. They will bake crispy and retain the basket shape for filling. Remove from oven and allow to cool on a wire rack.  Add the filling. Some examples include:
Cream cheese and salmon
Dill and mayo topped with a slice of smoked salmon
Bruschetta
Dips
Chopped cooked mixed veggies Finished.
